content.question: Which of the following arguments best supports a claim that the Electoral College does not fully support democratic principles?

choices.label: The winner-take-all system encourages candidates to campaign in every state, which limits the attention each state will receive from the candidates.
Electors are chosen by the voters in each state, which gives parties undue influence over candidates' success.
At times, a candidate who receives the most popular votes may not win the presidential election.
The Electoral College lacks transparency because electors frequently switch their vote during the national convention.

content.answer: At times, a candidate who receives the most popular votes may not win the presidential election.
